Conversion Coefficient error
========================================================

This is just an illustration of how badly thing can go wrong when conversion coefficients are misspecified.

```{r}

#load data
data('Sim')

# add to object
dats <- add_FA(FA.predators,FA.preys,fat.conts,CC.mean=1,CC.var=0.2)

dats <- select_vars(dats,plot=F)

Pop.FA <- run_MCMC(datas=dats,nIter=100000,nBurnin=10000,nChains=3,nThin=100,Data.Type='Fatty.Acid.Profiles',Analysis.Type='Population.proportions',Rnot = 1,plott=F,spawn=T)

summary(Pop.FA)
plot(Pop.FA,save=F)

proportions.path <- system.file("extdata", "Simdata_props.csv", package="fastinR")
proportions <- read.csv(proportions.path,header=F,row.names=1)

colnames(proportions) <- unique(dats$prey.ix)

proportions

# overall mean proportions
colMeans(proportions)

```
Compare this to the simualted example in the vignette, where estiamtion with FA alone gives reasonable results, with posteriors centered around the simualted diet proportions.
